Lost-page.description:
This page doesn't exist.
Maybe it never existed in the first place.
Lost-page.title: Page Not Found (404)

Delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this adventurer? This action cannot be undone.
Delete.label: Delete
Delete.title: Delete this Adventurer

Tracking.description: Minimal tracking helps improve Grimoire by collecting anonymous data on characters, page visits, and feature usage. No personal information is collected or shared.
Tracking.title: Anonymous tracking

Arcs.instructions:
Choose one or two character arcs to explore. Don't get too detailed—these will get fleshed out during play and can be changed anytime.
Character arcs are evocative phrases that give your PC a thematic direction. Find out where they lead through play— they're a starting direction, not the destination.
Take spark by resolving an arc with a meaningful moment, however big or small it is. This could mean achieving your goal, adjusting it for the next step, or moving on from it entirely.
Arcs.title: Arcs

Wises.instructions: Once you choose your background, give it three wises. Backgrounds and their wises should fit the campaign world and be approved by the GM.
Wises.placeholder-2: e.g. cultural tastes, signs of sin

Background.instructions: Your background represents your profession or social class, shaping what you know, how you act, and the kinds of story details you can add. They define the lived experiences that ground your character in the world.
Background.label: Background
Background.title: Background

Bonds.instructions:
Your dynamic with each PC. Match an intensity and a nature, or write your own. Interpret them as makes sense.
Bonds are your strongest view of the other PC, and not necessarily reciprocal (your tense doubts is their playful rivalry). You can change a bond anytime, such as in response to something they've done or something new you've learned about them. When it changes, give a short vignette (better if together!). The other PC takes spark.
Bonds.title: Bonds

Wises.instructions: Once you set your heritage, give it three wises, traits commonly shared by most people from your heritage.
Wises.placeholder-2: e.g. cultural tastes, signs of sin

Heritage.instructions: Heritage reflects your culture, ancestry, and homeland. You can use the heritage crucible for inspiration: roll three words, pick two, and combine them literally or figuratively.
Heritage.label: Heritage
Heritage.placeholder: e.g. Elves of Boomtown, Cityfolk of the Serene Kingdom, Vagrants of the Burning Barrens
Heritage.title: Heritage

Bard.description: You spin tales and songs that stir emotions, inspire bravery, and turn simple deeds into legends.
Bard.name: Bard

Berserker.description: You don’t just fight—you crush anything and everything in your path until nothing stands before you.
Berserker.name: Berserker

Cleric.description: You serve as a conduit for the divine, channeling holy power to safeguard the faithful and do your god's bidding.
Cleric.name: Cleric

Druid.description: You embrace and embody the untamed power of the natural world, transforming into beasts and channeling the spirit of the wild.
Druid.name: Druid

Fighter.description: You become one with your weapon, and through it, you find your real purpose in this life.
Fighter.name: Fighter

Monk.description: Your body is a vessel through which you channel your discipline into grace, precision, and the never-ending journey towards perfection.
Monk.name: Monk

Paladin.description: You have sworn an oath and your unwavering dedication gives you powerful conviction, which you can wield to better this world.
Paladin.name: Paladin

Ranger.description: You stalk relentlessly, moving unseen through the wilderness, tracking your prey with deadly precision, and striking them at their weakest point.
Ranger.name: Ranger

Rogue.description: You live and operate in the margins, striking unseen and disappearing before anyone knows you were there.
Rogue.name: Rogue

Sorcerer.description: You are a conduit for ancient and unpredictable forces, shaping spells out of the raw magic that flows through you.
Sorcerer.name: Sorcerer

Warlock.description: You have made a pact with a greater being—power in exchange for service, a pact that may prove to be a double-edged sword.
Warlock.name: Warlock

Wizard.description: You wield arcane power through precise knowledge, casting spells from an ever-expanding repertoire, your studies endless.
Wizard.name: Wizard

Path.instructions:
Choose a path and gain its core talent.
  • Core Growth: Your core talent powers up as you level. For "every 2 levels," gain bonuses at levels 2, 4, 6. For "every 3 levels," it's 3, 6. Remember that 7 is the maximum level.
  • Optional Character Building: Some paths include additional character-building features, marked with an [Optional] tag. If they're not relevant to your character, you can pass them up.
Path.title: Path

Desires.instructions: Choose 2 desires that you strongly desire and 1 that you don't at all. e.g. Love and thrills, not wealth.

Features.instructions: Write down three distinctive features, words or short phrases that others soon notice about you, like strong hands, kind eyes, or a gravelly voice.

Generator.instructions: Generate a name from name tables using markov chains or roll for a random name in the selected tables. This does not use generative AI.
Generator.label: Generate

Name.instructions: A good name reflects an adventurer's heritage and background. Enter a name that best fits your world, and fill in your real-world name for your character sheet.

Traits.instructions: Choose 2 traits that strongly describe you and 1 that definitely doesn't. e.g. Brave and rash, not quiet.

Stats.instructions: Begin with 1 in each stat, then assign 4 more points amongst them as you like, to a max of 3 in any single stat. Your core capabilities rated from 1/poor to 3/great, used for action and defense rolls.
Stats.title: Stats

According-to-plan.description: You gain 1 story per session and can spend story to flashback to utilizing subterfuge in a way that's immediately relevant, like swiping some keys, paying off a guard, or preparing an escape route. Make a montage roll, taking +1d for Expertise. The GM always takes sus- pense in place of an impact move.
According-to-plan.name: According to Plan

Aegis.description: You take +1d when defending with a shield and can use it to make a defense roll in a near- by ally's place. You can push yourself to defend multiple allies from a single attack, like blocking dragonfire. On a perfect, everyone you protected takes spark.
Aegis.name: Aegis

Alchemist.description: Each session, you have a 4d Potions resource pool. You can have a minor potion and roll the pool, or drop 1 and roll for a major potion. You know recipes for your spell theorems, plus two more rolled on the Spell Crucible. Learn new recipes by sacrificing potions.
Alchemist.name: Alchemist

Animal-companion.description:
You're accompanied by a fiercely loyal animal. Each PC adds a reciprocal bond with it. Choose 3 tricks that it knows and 2 flaws that it has:
Tricks: distract—fight—guard—perform—rescue—retrieve—scout—search—track—warn.
Flaws: aggressive—clumsy—grumpy—insatiable—jumpy—noisy—overprotective—scary—unruly.
You roll 3d for anything it knows a trick for and 1d on everything else. It has only two damage boxes, marked (for any mark) and hurt (for bloodied or rattled). You can always have it exit a scene when hurt. If lost, you can bond with a new animal or select a new talent.
Special: You can take this talent again to grant it 3 more tricks and another marked box.
Animal-companion.name: Animal Companion

Arcane-specialty.description: Choose your specialty school. All of your spell theorems now have it plus another school. When casting, choose which school to use. On a critical with your specialty school, take spark.
Arcane-specialty.name: Arcane Specialty

Arcane-training.description: You have spellcasting as the Spellcraft talent. You roll Wits and can cast 3 spells and 1 potent spell per session. You know 3 spell theorems, created with the Spell Crucible, and can learn new spells from scrolls.
Arcane-training.name: Arcane Training

Arcanist.description: You take +1d when rolling an arcana's pool and ignore the first die that would be dropped. You also gain 3 minor arcana and 1 major arcana that you've either created or found.
Arcanist.name: Arcanist

Authority.description: Your presence fills the air with authority. The GM judges an NPC's response, or you can spend story to set it: admiration—obedience—respect—defiance. You can push yourself to pull off a potent feat of righteous command, like ordering a demon to kneel or silencing a riot with a word.
Authority.name: Authority

Awaken.description: Once per scene, you may awaken a living natural feature—plants, animals, insects, fungi, or the like—within or nearby the scene. It gains awareness and purpose, forming a 3d power pool you can direct, guided by its nature. One time only, you can make this a ritual-level effect.
Awaken.name: Awaken

Bardic-lore.description: You gain any 3 wises and 1 extra story per session. You take +1d on any story rolls pertaining to what you know or story details you add.
Bardic-lore.name: Bardic Lore

Blessed.description: Once per session, you can re-roll a roll you just made as your god attempts to intervene. The re-roll is made without any thorns on it. On a perfect, take spark.
Blessed.name: Blessed

Bulwark.description: Each session, you have a 3d Bulwark resource pool from armor or other defenses. When you get bloodied or dropped from physical damage, roll the pool. If dice remain, ignore the damage
Bulwark.name: Bulwark

Challenge.description: You can push yourself to challenge a foe. You take +1d on all rolls against them, but give them 1 suspense. If they do anything besides confront you, you can interrupt it. On a perfect, the challenge continues. If an ally engages your foe, the challenge ends.
Challenge.name: Challenge

Colleagues.description: In every city, some towns, and the occasional dungeon, you can find a powerful, eccentric wizardly colleague who owes you a favor—or maybe you owe them one. If you go out of your way to meet and catch up, take spark.
Colleagues.name: Colleagues

Control.description: You can push yourself to declare a zone that enemies cannot cross without dealing with you. If they attempt to move past you, you can interrupt them. On a perfect, take spark.
Control.name: Control

Dauntless.description: Take spark when one of your rolls is cut. You also take +1d on the story roll when dropped. On a perfect, ignore getting dropped.
Dauntless.name: Dauntless

Devout.description: Intelligent creatures recognize you as a person of deep honesty and only your most hated enemies would treat you with a lack of respect or doubt your word. You are never serious- ly injured or killed by an enemy, unless they have no choice. Any creature with speech will always hear you out. This aura is upheld by your unwavering commitment—you must push yourself to act in bad faith (no free activation).
Devout.name: Devout

Divine-blessing.description: You have spellcasting as the Channel Divinity talent. Detail your god and choose one minor domain, a 4d power pool. You can drop 1 and roll the pool to cast a potent spell. It replenishes each session.
Divine-blessing.name: Divine Blessing

Dynamic-entrance.description: You can always appear in a scene anywhere and anytime, limited only by your physical capabilities. Make a 3d story roll to Set the Scene for your entrance.
Dynamic-entrance.name: Dynamic Entrance

Eldritch-affinity.description: You have spellcasting, as the Sorcery talent. You roll Presence to cast and choose 3 from magic paths and techniques that serve as touchstones. You can't cast potent spells, nor do you risk a wild surge.
Eldritch-affinity.name: Eldritch Affinity

Eldritch-growth.description: The maelstrom of magic has twisted your body. You gain a permanent physical feature like metal-rending claws, venomous fangs, leathery wings, or thrashing tentacles. In addition to its obvious benefits, it now serves as a touchstone.
Eldritch-growth.name: Eldritch Growth

Eldritch-weaponry.description: On a perfect when using cantrip utility as a weapon, you can push yourself to also inflict a spell-level effect with your patron's trappings as the touchstone. This effect can’t deal more damage—the cantrip already covers that.
Eldritch-weaponry.name: Eldritch Weaponry

Familiar.description: You manifest a small magical creature, an extension of yourself. You can communicate telepathically and send it on simple tasks, making a story roll to see how it goes. By enter- ing a trance, you can use its senses. You can also push yourself to cast a spell through it. If your familiar takes damage, it vanishes and reappears at the start of the next session.
Familiar.name: Familiar

Fearsome.description: Your presence instills fear in others. The GM judges an NPC's response, or you can spend story to set it: hostile—nervous—respectful—scared. You can push yourself to pull off a potent feat of intimidation, like staring down a dragon or demanding to see the king.
Fearsome.name: Fearsome

Flesh-wounds.description: When you take physical damage, only a disaster can drop you. You can get bloodied multiple times. Each extra time inflicts +1t on rolls. These extra thorns can never be ignored (e.g., Frenzy and Oathsworn talents) and they also apply thorns to any attempt to heal you.
Flesh-wounds.name: Flesh Wounds

Flow-state.description: After an action or defense roll, you can always keep the spotlight to prevent the GM from spending suspense. This continues as long as you keep taking action and don't roll a grim.
Flow-state.name: Flow State

Forked-tongue.description: When given time, you can tell potent lies like telling the king you're their bastard or a prophecy foretelling the fall of the capital. You can push yourself to do it on the spot.
Forked-tongue.name: Forked Tongue

Friendly-face.description: In any new town or district of a city you go to, you can always: get recognized by a fan—know someone useful—quickly make a friend. They'll gladly do you a reasonable favor. Take spark if you promise to pay them back.
Friendly-face.name: Friendly Face

Got-your-back.description: You can push yourself to assist an ally after they roll a grim. The ally can also roll 1d. On a perfect, you both take spark.
Got-your-back.name: Got Your Back

Guardian.description: You take +1d when you assist on a defense roll. If your own roll comes up as a 6, you both take spark.
Guardian.name: Guardian

Healer.description: You take +1d when you heal someone, with magic or treatment. On a critical, both of you take spark.
Healer.name: Healer

Healing-hands.description: You can heal an ally that is bloodied. This automatically works, but you must make a Presence defense roll against being bloodied—you take their pain onto yourself and must fend it off.
Healing-hands.name: Healing Hands

Herbalism.description: Before each session, use the Herbalism Crucible to make two herb names (snakeberry, blastbane). You have 1 minor potion of one and 1 major potion of the other. The name is the touchstone. They lose effect after the session. One time only, you can have 1 mythic potion (choose after rolling).
Herbalism.name: Herbalism

Hex.description: You can roll Presence to hex someone with: dread—clumsiness—confusion—forgetfulness—misfortune—sleepiness. Decide when it takes effect: now—soon—much later—specific trigger. This is a cosmic effect. It's magic, but not fully under your control.
Hex.name: Hex

Influence.description: Twice per session, you can invoke an ally's bond with you to increase their die roll result by 1 (3→4). You don't have to be in the same scene—they might recall a memory.
Influence.name: Influence

Into-the-fray.description: When you're the first into an intense situation, 5s count as 6s, but 4s count as 1s on your first roll. You also setup the first person following you regardless of your roll outcome.
Into-the-fray.name: Into the Fray

Iron-will.description: Each session, you have a 3d Iron Will resource pool. When you get rattled or take vex, roll the pool. If dice remain, ignore the damage. If the situation allows for it, you can also lash out at the cause or a bystander and: instill dread in their heart—sow doubt in their mind.
Iron-will.name: Iron Will

Jack-of-all-trades.description: Increase one of your stats that's a 1 to a 2. You also take +1d on montage rolls.
Jack-of-all-trades.name: Jack of All Trades

Joyful-warrior.description: On a critical or when bloodied in battle, you take spark and can: clear one mark from each ally—bring a dropped (not dead) ally back into the scene.
Joyful-warrior.name: Joyful Warrior

Keen-senses.description: Your senses are twice as sharp as normal. You can pull off potent feats of tracking and can always get a hint or reveal on vigilance against living creatures.
Keen-senses.name: Keen Senses

Kindred-spirits.description: You can speak with animals and spirits of the wild, their personalities shaped by their instincts. You are known to them—when you meet, roll their bond with you or spend story to establish it. When you call, those nearby will answer.
Kindred-spirits.name: Kindred Spirits

Knowing-gaze.description: When given time, you can stare into someone's eyes and learn: their greatest desire—what they're hiding—what they want to protect—who they serve. This is highly disconcerting and only works on someone once. You can push yourself to do this on the spot.
Knowing-gaze.name: Knowing Gaze

Lightning-reflexes.description: You can always act first, unless completely surprised. You also ignore difficulty thorns on Agility defense rolls.
Lightning-reflexes.name: Lightning Reflexes

Lurker.description: On a perfect sneaking past or secretly observing sentient creatures, they: let a secret slip—give you a golden opportunity. If caught sneaking, you can push yourself to stay completely still and avoid detection, but must leave the area immediately after.
Lurker.name: Lurker

Maelstrom.description: You open yourself fully to the maelstrom of raw magic. When you cast a potent spell, 5s count as 6s, but 4s count as 1s. These 4s also count as 1s towards wild surge.
Maelstrom.name: Maelstrom

Magic-sense.description: You always get a hint or reveal on vigilance involving magic. When you avoid or disrupt it, take spark.
Magic-sense.name: Magic Sense

Mastered-theorem.description: Choose one of your spell theorems. You take +1d when casting it and gain 1 extra potent spell casting of it per session. Your name becomes linked to it and it begins to spread in popularity throughout wizardry—track its spread with campaign pools.
Mastered-theorem.name: Mastered Theorem

Measured-tones.description: When you speak in measured tones, people always stop and listen—you can declare tame stakes if desired. Unless completely surprised, you can push yourself to interrupt an impact move initiating aggression. If you change their mind, take spark.
Measured-tones.name: Measured Tones

Mighty.description: When given time, you can pull off potent feats of raw strength, like uprooting a tree or breaking through a castle gate. You can push yourself to do it on the spot.
Mighty.name: Mighty

Mind-over-matter.description: When you take a physical mark, you can instead choose to take a mental mark. When you clear any mark by rolling it, take spark.
Mind-over-matter.name: Mind Over Matter

Opportunist.description: When someone nearby rolls defense, you take +1d on an immediate follow-up. On a crit- ical by a nearby ally, you can push yourself to add another critical bonus.
Opportunist.name: Opportunist

Otherworldly-form.description: You can turn into a floating, dispersed form, flavored after your patron's trappings (swarm of bats, blowing leaves). Choose three things you can do in this form: appear barely visible—fly high in the sky—interact with objects—move swiftly—slip through small gaps—speak.
Otherworldly-form.name: Otherworldly Form

Overkill.description: On a critical when bringing violence, threats, or destruction to bear, you can: cause an extra secondary effect—roll a task pool twice.
Overkill.name: Overkill

Poisoner.description: Each session, you have a 4d Poisons resource pool. You have access to the following poisons: hallucinations—knockout—memory loss—nausea—paralysis—truth serum. They each take a bit of time to work and are most effective if ingested.
Poisoner.name: Poisoner

Prepared-spell.description: You gain 1 story per session and can spend story to flashback to casting a spell with specific triggers. If you need to roll a montage to get access to a place, the GM always takes suspense in place of an impact move. Roll for the spell's effectiveness now.
Prepared-spell.name: Prepared Spell

Primordial-bonds.description: You have a bond with each of the primordial elements, Air, Earth, Fire, and Water. Roll the bonds, then change one to deep. You have spellcasting, rolling Presence to call on an element, which serves as the touchstone. You can call on each element once per session,or twice if your bond is deep. You can mark two usages of a single element to cast a potentspell. You can combine usages of two elements to take +1d and use both as a touchstone. Bonds change, for better or worse—pursue great deeds and rituals to deepen them.
Primordial-bonds.name: Primordial Bonds

Primordial-forces.description:
Choose an element: Air—Earth—Fire—Water. You can cast cantrips with that element, useful as set dressing and cantrip utility. On a critical using your element, charge it (mark its box). Spend it to pull off a potent feat of force or movement empowered by the element.
Special: You can take this again, gaining all elements. On a critical, charge two elements.
Primordial-forces.name: Primordial Forces

Rebuke.description: When the GM spends suspense to prompt an impact move, you take +1d on any follow-up action against the source. On a critical, take spark.
Rebuke.name: Rebuke

Relentless.description: You can pull off potent feats of traversal and can always move at full speed, unhindered by what's in your way.
Relentless.name: Relentless

Rings-false.description: You always know when someone is lying, though not necessarily the truth. You take +1d on a follow-up if you reveal you know they're lying.
Rings-false.name: Rings False

Ritualist.description: You take +1d when working towards overcoming a ritual's challenge and can replace any one of a ritual's anchors with yourself.
Ritualist.name: Ritualist

Scout-ahead.description: You gain 1 story per session and can spend story to flashback to scouting ahead and: sabotage something—set a trap—set up an interrupt—survey the area (ask 2 questions)—take out a danger. Make a montage roll, taking +1d for prowess. The GM always takes suspense in place of an impact move.
Scout-ahead.name: Scout Ahead

Seasoned-hunter.description: You always know where a monster's lair will be. Once per session, you can tell all to Look Out! and declare how a monstrous challenge spends 1 of its suspense on a move to attack your party. Anyone involved takes +1d on a defense roll and follow-up action rolls.
Seasoned-hunter.name: Seasoned Hunter

Sermons.description: When given time, you can pull off potent feats of persuasion in the name of your beliefs, like commanding a crowd to bring the duke for judgment or showing the goblins the glory of your god. You can also push yourself to do it on the spot. One time only, you can make this a ritual-level effect
Sermons.name: Sermons

Sharpshooter.description: When given time, you can pull off potent feats of ranged precision, like shooting just beyond maximum range or into near complete cover. You can also push yourself to do it on the spot.
Sharpshooter.name: Sharpshooter

Shepherd.description: When you assist an ally on a defense roll that would leave them rattled or with vex, you can invoke your bond to take +1d on the roll. On a perfect, you both take spark.
Shepherd.name: Shepherd

Spelleater.description: Each session, you have a 3d Spelleater resource pool. When you suffer from magic, roll the pool. If dice remain, ignore the effect and bank essence (max 2). You can spend essence to increase a spellcasting die result by 1, but it triggers wild surge.
Spelleater.name: Spelleater

Subtle-casting.description: You can always cast spells subtly, able to conceal that you were the one that cast it. This doesn't defeat common sense, of course.
Subtle-casting.name: Subtle Casting

Swift-recovery.description: On a perfect roll with an unmarked stat, clear a mark on another stat.
Swift-recovery.name: Swift Recovery

Tactician.description: During an intense action sequence, you can push yourself to tag 3 scene elements right away and 1 later in the sequence. When an ally interacts with a tagged element, you assist without risk on the roll. If no roll is needed, they take spark.
Tactician.name: Tactician

Tether.description: Once per session, you can touch someone to link your spirits. You can sense their feelings and always know where they are. You can push yourself to: assist them—speak into their mind—take mental damage for them—teleport to them. If they get dropped, so do you. You must touch again or rest for the link to end. When it does, change (or create) your bond with them.
Tether.name: Tether

There-is-no-try.description: When putting your life or something you hold equally dear on the line, 5s count as 6s, but 4s count as 1s. This generally occurs with dire stakes or after being bloodied in battle.
There-is-no-try.name: There is No Try

Trap-sense.description: You always get a hint or reveal on vigilance against traps. When you avoid or disable a trap, take spark.
Trap-sense.name: Trap Sense

Trophies.description: When you play a key part in slaying a powerful monster, you can harvest a trophy from it. This acts as a wand that only you can use. Minor trophies require no roll to harvest. Major trophies require a Wits action roll. The monster's name, ability, and body part are the touchstone. You also gain one major trophy when you take this—detail it.
Trophies.name: Trophies

True-shape.description: Choose 1 beast form. If it has no wild talents, you can shift into it without rolling wild shape, even at 0d. If it has wild talents, you drop 1d less than normal when you shift.
True-shape.name: True Shape

Verdant-whispers.description: You can commune with plants, their personalities as odd and unique as their forms. Roll Wits to decipher their messages, as they remember all but speak in ways truly hard to understand. You always get a hint or reveal on vigilance in places teeming with plant life.
Verdant-whispers.name: Verdant Whispers

Visions.description: You can roll Presence to ask your patron for forbidden knowledge, like tightly held secrets or that which should not be known. Ask the GM a specific question. The answer may be cryptic or twisted to suit your patron’s desires, but it will never be an outright lie. On a messy or grim, roll the Patience pool.
Visions.name: Visions

Warsongs.description: Each session, you can sing 2 bardsongs. Write down the composition of the only 3 songs you know.
Warsongs.name: Warsongs

Wayfarer.description: You can push yourself to teleport. The further or less familiar the destination, the less precise the teleport is. The maximum range is two days' ride away. Anything within clear eyesight with no obstruction requires no roll, otherwise make a story roll. You can bring others, taking +1t per person.
Wayfarer.name: Wayfarer

Weasel.description: If caught in a lie or red-handed, you can push yourself to weasel your way out of the situation—for now. You get an exit, but they definitely realize what happened soon after.
Weasel.name: Weasel

Windcaller.description: Your voice carries on the winds over great distances. You can push yourself to summon or dismiss, but not control: dense fog—diving temperatures—heavy rain—snowfall—strong winds— thunder. You can perform weather rituals without ritual anchors.
Windcaller.name: Windcaller

Wisps.description: Two small spheres of your magic path float around you. Give them 2 traits: annoying—capricious—malevolent—mesmerizing—whimsical. They serve as touchstones. You can sacrifice one to: assist without risk—distract someone—send a brief message far away—suffer vex in your stead. Make story rolls to determine effects if sacrificed. They return each session.
Wisps.name: Wisps

Wordplay.description: On a perfect defense roll when the situation allows for verbal quips, you make them: embarrass themself—let a secret slip—focus on or lose track of you. Once per session, you can goad the GM into spending suspense on conversation.
Wordplay.name: Wordplay

Wrath.description: When you or a nearby ally gets bloodied, rattled, or dropped, you take +1d and potency on your next spell if you immediately lash out.
Wrath.name: Wrath

Talents.instructions:
Choose either a talent from your path's list or a non-core talent from another path.
Explain how your character picked up these skills.
Talents.no-added-talents: Add a talent from the list below.
Talents.no-results: No talents found. Try adjusting your search filters.
Talents.title: Talents
